page.title: 01Johnstone
page.content: The block contains most of Johnstone, part of Kilbarchan and the outskirts of Elderslie in the Renfrew District of Strathclyde Region. It lies approx. 4 miles from Paisley and 11 miles west of Glasgow. The town with a population of 23,000, was planned by George Houston in 1781, grew in the 19th century during the Industrial Revolution developing cotton and engineering industries. It is a residential area, most of the industry being to the north. To the south and east it is mainly agricultural, rough grazing. There is a station on the railway line from Glasgow to Stranraer and a section of the A737, main links Glasgow to Clyde coast. Both high schools and most of the primaries are also inside the area. The block contains several parks and other recreational facilities.
